Comment: China’s “place-of-origin washing” isn’t outsmarting Trump’s tariffs—it’s an old trick. Rerouting goods through Malaysia or South Korea to dodge 145% U.S. levies is costly and risky, with only $21 million in fakes caught in Q1 2025, peanuts next to $439 billion in Chinese imports. U.S. customs are tightening rules, closing loopholes like de minimis. Tariffs are hurting China—export share to the U.S. dropped from 20% to 15% since 2017, and their trade surplus is shrinking. This is a desperate hustle, not a win. Xi’s bravado is just domestic flexing.
